text:
When using <error-page> in web.xml the path to the error page is not considered 
relative to the context and because of that it can not find a handler for the 
path. If the full path is specified then the handler is found but the url gets 
prefixed by the context path the second time.

To fix this I modified org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.java

1052c1052
<           errorServlet=getHandlerForPath( ctx, errorPath );
---
>           errorServlet=getHandlerForPath( ctx, ctx.getPath()  + "/" + 
errorPath );
1158c1158
<           errorServlet=getHandlerForPath( ctx, errorPath );
---
>           errorServlet=getHandlerForPath( ctx, ctx.getPath()  + "/" + 
errorPath );
creator: obender2@hotmail.com
obender2@hotmail.com
text: The described fix is not correct.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
The implemented behavior is that the path to the resource is expected to
begin with a "/" which will be resolved relative to the root of the web
application.  Though not spelled out in the spec, if the path does not
begin with a "/", it is assumed to be the name of a servlet specified in
the web.xml.

Since there isn't enough information to determine if this is an actual bug or
user error, I'm marking this bug as INVALID.

If you can't get the behavior above to work for you, reopen the bug and
supply an example of exactly what isn't working.  Thanks.
